factoid: Princess Mary lay supported by pillows.
Princess Mary wore a white cap on her head.
Princess Mary's pains had just left her.
Strands of Princess Mary's black hair lay around her inflamed and perspiring cheeks.
Princess Mary's charming rosy mouth had a downy lip that was open.
Princess Mary was smiling joyfully.
Prince Andrew entered the room.
Prince Andrew paused facing Princess Mary.
Prince Andrew paused at the foot of the sofa on which Princess Mary was lying.
Princess Mary's glittering eyes were filled with childlike fear and excitement.
Princess Mary's glittering eyes rested on Prince Andrew without changing their expression.
Princess Mary said, "I love you all and have done no harm to anyone; why must I suffer so? Help me!"
Princess Mary's look seemed to say that she loved everyone and had done no harm to anyone, and she wanted help.
Princess Mary saw Prince Andrew.
Princess Mary did not realize the significance of Prince Andrew's appearance before her.
Prince Andrew went around the sofa.
Prince Andrew kissed Princess Mary's forehead.
Prince Andrew said, "My darling!" to Princess Mary.
Prince Andrew had never used the phrase "My darling!" to Princess Mary before.
Prince Andrew said, "God is merciful."
Princess Mary looked at Prince Andrew inquiringly and with childlike reproach.
Princess Mary's eyes said, "I expected help from you and I get none, none from you either!"
Princess Mary was not surprised at Prince Andrew having come.
Princess Mary did not realize that Prince Andrew had come.
Prince Andrew's coming had nothing to do with Princess Mary's sufferings or their relief.
Princess Mary's pangs began again.
Mary Bogdánovna advised Prince Andrew to leave the room.
The doctor entered the room.
Prince Andrew went out of the room.
Prince Andrew met Princess Mary.
Prince Andrew joined Princess Mary again.
Prince Andrew and Princess Mary began talking in whispers.
Their talk broke off at every moment.
Prince Andrew and Princess Mary waited and listened.
Princess Mary said, "Go, dear."
Prince Andrew went again to his wife.
Prince Andrew sat waiting in the room next to Princess Mary's room.
A woman came from the bedroom with a frightened face.
The woman became confused when she saw Prince Andrew.
Prince Andrew covered his face with his hands.
Prince Andrew remained with his face covered for some minutes.
Piteous, helpless, animal moans came through the door.
Prince Andrew got up.
Prince Andrew went to the door.
Prince Andrew tried to open the door.
Someone was holding the door shut.
A terrified voice from within said, "You can't come in! You can't!"
Prince Andrew began pacing the room.
The screaming ceased.
A few more seconds passed.
Suddenly a terrible shriek came from the bedroom.
The terrible shriek could not be from Princess Mary.
Princess Mary could not scream like that.
Prince Andrew ran to the door.
The scream ceased.
Prince Andrew heard the wail of an infant.
Prince Andrew thought, "What have they taken a baby in there for?"
Prince Andrew thought, "A baby?"
Prince Andrew thought, "What baby?"
Prince Andrew thought, "Why is there a baby there?"
Prince Andrew thought, "Or is the baby born?"
Prince Andrew suddenly realized the joyful significance of the infant's wail.
Tears choked Prince Andrew.
Prince Andrew leaned his elbows on the window sill.
Prince Andrew began to cry, sobbing like a child.
The door opened.
The doctor came out of the room with his shirt sleeves tucked up, without a coat, pale, and with a trembling jaw.
Prince Andrew turned to the doctor.
The doctor gave Prince Andrew a bewildered look.
The doctor passed by Prince Andrew without a word.
A woman rushed out.
The woman saw Prince Andrew and stopped, hesitating on the threshold.
Prince Andrew went into his wife's room.
Princess Mary was lying dead in the same position Prince Andrew had seen her in five minutes before.
Princess Mary had fixed eyes and pallor of the cheeks.
Princess Mary's charming childlike face had its upper lip covered with tiny black hair.
Princess Mary's dead face said, "I love you all, and have done no harm to anyone; and what have you done to me?"
In a corner of the room something red and tiny gave a grunt and squealed in Mary Bogdánovna's trembling white hands.
Two hours later Prince Andrew stepped softly into his father's room.
Prince Andrew's father already knew everything.
Prince Andrew's father was standing close to the door.
As soon as the door opened, Prince Andrew's father's rough old arms closed like a vise around Prince Andrew's neck.
Prince Andrew's father began to sob like a child without a word.
Three days later Princess Mary was buried.
Prince Andrew went up the steps to the coffin.
Prince Andrew gave Princess Mary a farewell kiss.
The coffin contained Princess Mary's face with closed eyes.
Princess Mary's face in the coffin still seemed to say, "Ah, what have you done to me?"
Prince Andrew felt that something gave way in his soul.
Prince Andrew felt guilty of a sin he could neither remedy nor forget.
Prince Andrew could not weep.
Prince Andrew's father came up and kissed the waxen little hands that lay quietly cross one on the other on Princess Mary's breast.
Prince Andrew's father's face seemed to say, "Ah, what have you done to me, and why?"
At the sight, Prince Andrew's father turned angrily away.
